instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No S0 rails
threads.message:
Liquid damaged board, has some signs of work already.

Green / Orange MagSafe

PP3V42 = 3V42
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.6
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3V3


No S0 Enables
No <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3</SIGNAL> = 0V
<CHIP>U8180</CHIP> has power to it

No pulsing on S0 rails.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No S0 rails
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No S0 rails
threads.message: You start with SUS and <SIGNAL>SLP_S4</SIGNAL> stuff, <SIGNAL>SLP_S3</SIGNAL> comes later. Are you using the correct charger 60W or more?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No S0 rails
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7721"]You start with SUS and <SIGNAL>SLP_S4</SIGNAL> stuff, <SIGNAL>SLP_S3</SIGNAL> comes later. Are you using the correct charger 60W or more?[/QUOTE]

Ah, hello. I only have a 60Watt charger with a MagSafe to Magsafe2 shape adapter ATM, lost my 85W.

[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7721"]You start with SUS and <SIGNAL>SLP_S4</SIGNAL> stuff, <SIGNAL>SLP_S3</SIGNAL> comes later.[/QUOTE]

I'll check SUS and <SIGNAL>SLP_S4</SIGNAL>

I have a couple of questions if on of you guys would not mind answering.....
I have been going in circles on the schematic, noting what turns on what. S3 is sleep state right? So, what is the S4?
What rail powers the PCH?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No S0 rails
threads.message: Go and buy some real chargers.
